moves.1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bc4 Nf6 4. Nc3: ?! A weak move that allows Black to equalize immediately.
moves.4... Nxe4 5. Nxe4 d5 6. Bd3 dxe4 7. Bxe4: Not the most accurate. I think Nb4 would have been slightly better.
moves.9. Bb2: ? Allowing the occupation of the center by Black pawns.
moves.9... f5 10. Bd5: Maybe White could have tried to take the e5+f5 pawns for its light-squared bishop, trying to put Black's King into a mating net.
moves.10... c6 11. Bc4 Nxc4 12. bxc4 e4: Here White is simply worse. Now I gain more space threatening White's pieces.
moves.13. Ng1 O-O 14. Nh3 f4: Similar would have been Qh4, stopping the Qh5 move.
moves.18. Qxe4: I think cxb5 Bxf4 Nxf4 would have been better, since it preserves more asimmetry into the position, and so more chances to create threats against my King.
moves.22. Qg2 Rxc2 23. Rfg1 Be5 24. Rae1 Rxc4: Now, when playing Rc2, you should have seen Rf8.
moves.30. Qxd4: It allows mate in 1, but the other alternatives were hopeless.
